column4: How i start a software that i installed with Ubuntu Software Center and doesn't appear in the Applications MENU?
dpkg -L packagename | grep bin is the very low level way
yes, dpkg -L swftools | grep bin
i typed that command in the terminal and doesn't appear nothing on my screen..
are you sure it was named 'swftools'?  Are you sure you installed it?
yes, swftools
try sudo apt-get install swftools
swftools is already the newest version
if it not works..or isn't anyway to use it...what other swf decompiler is available ?
which swfextract
what do you mean ?
it's a command: which swfextract
what should i do with it? i typed and : /usr/bin/swfextract
okay, so it's installed, but for some reason dpkg -L is failing, odd
the executable names match the names in bold here: http://www.swftools.org/
alright..
what're you trying to do exacdtly?
swftools doesn't make that quite as easy, IME
you might want to use Wine with a win32 app
alright..i'll use wine.
not saying you can't do it with Unix utils, but it'll be less "easy"
i understand and i know..it will be a day when i will be able to use the terminal more then the GUI
maybe you should install software on yourself
haha =)) i'm invincibile...mega extra big firewall
